alert.note: Alert for Haralson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 9:03PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Coosa River at Mayo`s Bar near Rome affecting Floyd County. Tallapoosa River at US 78 near Tallapoosa affecting Haralson County. Little River at GA 5 near Woodstock affecting Cherokee County. Etowah River Downstream I-575 at Canton affecting Cherokee County. Chattahoochee River at US 41 at Atlanta affecting Cobb and Fulton Counties. For the Oostanaula River Basin...including Resaca, Calhoun, Calhoun, Armuchee, Rome, Rome, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Etowah River Basin...including Landrum, Russell Creek downstream of Head Lake Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Matt, Ball Ground, Canton, Old GA 5 below Ball Ground, Canton, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Noonday Creek above Chastain Meadows Pkwy Marietta, Woodstock, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Acworth, Allatoona Dam above Cartersville, Rockmart, Cartersville, Dallas, Kingston, Kingston, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Union, Columbus, Omaha...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tallapoosa River at US 78 near Tallapoosa. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 78. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Wednesday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
